item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://localhost/mywordpress.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Services

Web Design

We create custom web design for small businesses, this will help you capture new audiences and increase your sales. Contact us by calling, emailing or filling out our form. You will receive a free quote by email within 24 hours.

Explore

Graphic Design

We specialize in logos, merchandise and more. Anyone can create nice graphics but its much better to create memorable ones. Contact us by calling, emailing or filling out our form. You will receive a free quote by email within 24 hours.

Explore

Content Writing

Want to attract people to your website? You have to have the best content in the world. Our content writers will create award willing content for you. Contact us by calling, emailing or filling out our form. You will receive a free quote by email within 24 hours. Explore

Have any questions? We are always open to talk about your business, new projects, creative opportunities and how we can help you.

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Find Your Dream Home Today

House hunting can be toughbudget constraints, limited options, and rising prices can make the process feel overwhelming. But dont worry, its not impossible. With patience, flexibility, and persistence, you can find the perfect home.

Stay focused, stay positive, and take it one step at a time!

Find Your Perfect Home

For Rent
  • Residential

Modern Apartment

$ 1500/mo

3 bd / 2 ba / 1100 Sq Ft

For Sale
  • Residential

Family Home

$ 175,000

4 bd / 3 ba / 2700 Sq Ft

For Rent
  • Commercial

Modern Apartment

$ 2000/mo

3 bd / 3 ba / 1450 Sq Ft

For Sale
  • Commercial

Elegant Studio Flat

$ 138,000

3 bd / 2 ba / 1100 Sq Ft

We\'re Here To Help You

What Are You Looking For?

Apartments

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

Find Apartments

Houses

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

Find Houses

Shared Accommodation

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs.

Find Shared Accommodation

Unilodge

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.

Find Unilodge

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME MATE

House hunting can be toughbudget constraints, limited options, and rising prices can make the process feel overwhelming. But dont worry, its not impossible. With patience, flexibility, and persistence, you can find the perfect home.

Stay focused, stay positive, and take it one step at a time!


Explore

What Are You Looking For?

APARTMENTS

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

HOUSES

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

SHARED HOUSES

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs

UNILODGE

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.


Explore More

Click the apps below to find accommodation






Tips For Finding Suitable Housing
  1. Start early and research areas close to your university or public transport.
  2. Consider the cost of rent, utilities, and other living expenses.
  3. Read reviews and inspect properties if possible before signing a lease.
  4. Be aware of your rights as a tenantknow what is included in the rent agreement.
  5. You usually need a 4-week bond to secure accommodation.

Note: A bond is a security deposit that tenants pay before moving into a rental property. It serves as financial protection for the landlord in case of unpaid rent or property damage.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It\'s different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I\'m a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin\' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: http://localhost/mywordpress.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME MATE

House hunting can be toughbudget constraints, limited options, and rising prices can make the process feel overwhelming. But dont worry, its not impossible. With patience, flexibility, and persistence, you can find the perfect home.

Stay focused, stay positive, and take it one step at a time!

Explore

What Are You Looking For?

APARTMENTS

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

HOUSES

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

SHARED HOUSES

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs

UNILODGE

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.

Explore More

Click the apps below to find accommodation

Tips For Finding Suitable Housing
  1. Start early and research areas close to your university or public transport.
  2. Consider the cost of rent, utilities, and other living expenses.
  3. Read reviews and inspect properties if possible before signing a lease.
  4. Be aware of your rights as a tenantknow what is included in the rent agreement.
  5. You usually need a 4-week bond to secure accommodation.

Note: A bond is a security deposit that tenants pay before moving into a rental property. It serves as financial protection for the landlord in case of unpaid rent or property damage.

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME MATE

House hunting can be toughbudget constraints, limited options, and rising prices can make the process feel overwhelming. But dont worry, its not impossible. With patience, flexibility, and persistence, you can find the perfect home.

Stay focused, stay positive, and take it one step at a time!

Explore

What Are You Looking For?

APARTMENTS

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

HOUSES

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

SHARED HOUSES

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs

UNILODGE

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.

Explore More

Click the apps below to find accommodation

Tips For Finding Suitable Housing
  1. Start early and research areas close to your university or public transport.
  2. Consider the cost of rent, utilities, and other living expenses.
  3. Read reviews and inspect properties if possible before signing a lease.
  4. Be aware of your rights as a tenantknow what is included in the rent agreement.
  5. You usually need a 4-week bond to secure accommodation.

Note: A bond is a security deposit that tenants pay before moving into a rental property. It serves as financial protection for the landlord in case of unpaid rent or property damage.

item.title: Bank
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Setting Up a Bank Account

A step-by-step guide to help international students manage their finances with ease.

Required Documents

When opening a bank account, you will need to provide essential documents such as a government-issued ID, proof of address, and, in some cases, proof of income. It's best to check with the bank beforehand to ensure you have all the necessary paperwork.

  • Passport
  • Student Visa
  • Proof of Australian Address
  • OSHC (Overseas Student Health Cover) Certificate
  • Australian Phone Number
  • Proof of birth
Get started today!

List of Popular Banks among International Students

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Ut elit tellus, luctus nec ullamcorper mattis, pulvinar.

Commonwealth Bank (CBA)

One of the largest banks in Australia, offering a wide range of banking services with an easy-to-use mobile app and student-friendly accounts.

Westpac

Known for its strong security features, extensive ATM network, and tailored banking solutions for international students.

ANZ (Australia and New Zealand Banking Group)

Offers flexible account options, competitive fees, and great digital banking features.

NAB (National Australia Bank)

Provides fee-free student accounts, good customer support, and simple online banking services.

Steps to Open a Bank Account

01

Choose a Bank

Tortor sed nulla gravida ipsum aliquam consectetur neque odio dui turpis fringilla hac bibendum commodo proin quam posuere consequat.

02

Apply Online or Visit a Branch

Tortor sed nulla gravida ipsum aliquam consectetur neque odio dui turpis fringilla hac bibendum commodo proin quam posuere consequat.

03

Submit Required Documents

Tortor sed nulla gravida ipsum aliquam consectetur neque odio dui turpis fringilla hac bibendum commodo proin quam posuere consequat.

04

Receive Account Details & Debit Card

Tortor sed nulla gravida ipsum aliquam consectetur neque odio dui turpis fringilla hac bibendum commodo proin quam posuere consequat.

Need guidance? Connect with a buddy today!

Find A Buddy!

  • Student Visa
  • Proof of Australian Address

One of the largest banks in Australia, offering a wide range of banking services with an easy-to-use mobile app and student-friendly accounts.

Westpac

Known for its strong security features, extensive ATM network, and tailored banking solutions for international students.

ANZ (Australia and New Zealand Banking Group)

Offers flexible account options, competitive fees, and great digital banking features.

NAB (National Australia Bank)

Provides fee-free student accounts, good customer support, and simple online banking services.

item.title: Jobs
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Job Opportunities in Australia

Finding a job in Australia helps international students gain experience and support their studies. With the right approach, securing part-time or casual work is possible.

Essential Documents for Job Applications

  1. Valid Visa with Work Rights:
    Ensure your Student Visa (Subclass 500) allows work.
    Students can work up to 48 hours per fortnight during study periods.
  2. Tax File Number (TFN) or Australian Business Number (ABN):
    TFN is required for employment.
    ABN is needed for freelancing or contract work.
  3. Resume & Cover Letter:
    Keep your resume concise (1-2 pages). Click here to view samples.
    Customize each cover letter based on the job you apply for.
  4. Australian Bank Account:
    Needed for salary payments via direct deposit.
  5. Superannuation Account:
    If you earn more than $450 per month, your employer must pay super contributions.
  6. Required Certifications (If Applicable):
    • RSA (Responsible Service of Alcohol) for hospitality jobs.
    • White Card for construction work.
    • Working with Children Check for childcare or teaching jobs.
    • Yellow Card - for Aged care jobs

Top Job Search Apps & Websites

Tips for Getting a Job Fast

1. Prepare a Strong Resume & Cover Letter
  • Keep your resume concise (1-2 pages).
  • Tailor your cover letter for each job application.
2. Check University Joblinx & Career Services

Joblinxis an internship placement and career progression specialist, and as a JCU Brisbane student you can access their services for free. This includes employment support, work experience opportunities, internship opportunities, and access to a range of training programs and workshops that facilitate the development of skills that are necessary for success in a global workplace.

3. Be Flexible & Open to Entry-Level Jobs

Consider casual or part-time work in hospitality, retail, or customer service.

4. Apply In-Person for Retail & Hospitality Jobs

Many businesses prefer walk-in applications with a printed resume.

5. Start Applying Early

Student job openings are often filled quickly, so its best to apply as soon as possible.

Need guidance? Connect with a buddy today!

Find A Buddy!

{"timeout":1740488783,"value":{"content":"

Job Opportunities in Australia

[elementor-element data=""]

Essential Documents for Job Applications

[elementor-element data=""]

Top Job Search Apps & Websites

Tips for Getting a Job Fast

1. Prepare a Strong Resume & Cover Letter
  • Keep your resume concise (1-2 pages).
  • Tailor your cover letter for each job application.
2. Check University Joblinx & Career Services

Joblinx is an internship placement and career progression specialist, and as a JCU Brisbane student you can access their services for free. This includes employment support, work experience opportunities, internship opportunities, and access to a range of training programs and workshops that facilitate the development of skills that are necessary for success in a global workplace.

3. Be Flexible & Open to Entry-Level Jobs

Consider casual or part-time work in hospitality, retail, or customer service.

4. Apply In-Person for Retail & Hospitality Jobs

Many businesses prefer walk-in applications with a printed resume.

5. Start Applying Early

Student job openings are often filled quickly, so it’s best to apply as soon as possible.

Need guidance? Connect with a buddy today!

Find A Buddy!

item.title: Accommodation
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
WELCOME MATE

House hunting can be toughbudget constraints, limited options, and rising prices can make the process feel overwhelming. But dont worry, its not impossible. With patience, flexibility, and persistence, you can find the perfect home.

Stay focused, stay positive, and take it one step at a time!

Get Started

What Are You Looking For?

Apartment

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

House

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

SHARED HOUSES

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs

UNILODGE

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.

Apps to Apply for Accommodation

Tips For Finding Suitable Housing

  • Start early and research areas close to your university or public transport.
  • Consider the cost of rent, utilities, and other living expenses.
  • Read reviews and inspect properties if possible before signing a lease.
  • Be aware of your rights as a tenantknow what is included in the rent agreement.
  • You usually need a 4-week bond to secure accommodation.
  • Avoid scams, especially when searching for accommodation on Facebook Marketplace.

Need guidance? Connect with a buddy today!

Find A Buddy!

{"timeout":1740488767,"value":{"content":"

WELCOME MATE

[elementor-element data=""]
Get Started

What Are You Looking For?

Apartment

A private living space with one or more bedrooms, typically in a building with other apartments. Ideal for those who want more independence.

House

A standalone property, offering more space and privacy. Perfect for families or those who prefer a more secluded living environment.

SHARED HOUSES

A room or space shared with others, often in a house or apartment. A more budget-friendly option for individuals looking to share living costs

UNILODGE

Student accommodation, typically located near university campuses. Offers both shared and private living spaces, with student-focused amenities.

Apps to Apply for Accommodation

Tips For Finding Suitable Housing

  • Start early and research areas close to your university or public transport.
  • Consider the cost of rent, utilities, and other living expenses.
  • Read reviews and inspect properties if possible before signing a lease.
  • Be aware of your rights as a tenant—know what is included in the rent agreement.
  • You usually need a 4-week bond to secure accommodation.
  • Avoid scams, especially when searching for accommodation on Facebook Marketplace.

Need guidance? Connect with a buddy today!

Find A Buddy!
","scripts":[],"styles":[]}}

item.title: Public Transport
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Navigating Public Transport System

Public transportation is essential for students, offering an affordable and convenient way to commute to classes and explore the city. For international students, it provides an easy, eco-friendly option to travel and access key services.

Understanding Public Transport Options

Trains
Trams
Buses
Ferries
